Class OfflineController

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Created by fc1, eivenlour on 2018-03-29.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteFromArrayList()
      This function deletes the first element in the list and stores the new taskList back to the local file
      boolean fileExists()
      Checks if the file exists, if it does, assign taskList to the list from the file; if it doesn't, set the taskList to be an empty list, then returns a boolean
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> loadFromFile()
      This function reads in the list stored in the file and assign it to taskList
      void saveInFile(Task task)
      appends the task to taskList and write the new taskList into the local file
      void updateInFile(Task task)
      This function updates a task in the local file

    • Method Detail

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists()
        Checks if the file exists, if it does, assign taskList to the list from the file; if it doesn't, set the taskList to be an empty list, then returns a boolean
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating if the file exists or not

      • saveInFile

        public void saveInFile(Task task)
        appends the task to taskList and write the new taskList into the local file
        Parameters:
        task - task to be added to the local file

      • updateInFile

        public void updateInFile(Task task)
        This function updates a task in the local file
        Parameters:
        task - task to be updated

      • loadFromFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> loadFromFile()
        This function reads in the list stored in the file and assign it to taskList
        Returns:
        taskList which is a list of tasks stored in the local file

      • deleteFromArrayList

        public void deleteFromArrayList()
        This function deletes the first element in the list and stores the new taskList back to the local file
